article.title: Submarine Imaging System Contract Modified
article.author: George I. Seffers
article.text: Lockheed Martin Mission Systems and Sensors, Manassas, Va., is being awarded a $12,276,792 cost-plus-incentive-fee modification to previously awarded contract to exercise an option for engineering service support of the AN/BVY-1 Integrated Submarine Imaging System (ISIS). The AN/BVY-1 ISIS provides mission critical, all-weather, visual, and electronic search, digital image management, indication, warning and platform architecture interface capabilities for U.S. Navy submarines. The Naval Sea Systems Command, Washington, D.C., is the contracting activity.
